descriptionSet.description: The movie "Aladdin and the Wonderful Lamp" (directed by Homi Wadia) got released in 1952. Aladdin (Mahipal) is depicted during a sword duel with the wicked courtier close to a palace like surrounding, with the djinni above holding Aladdins' palace in his hands.
Photo of a theatre stage with backdrop.

inscription.text: Basant Pictures presents Aladdin And The Wonderful Lamp
Produced and Directed by HOMI WADIA

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Basant Pictures presents Aladdin And The Wonderful Lamp
text-en: Wadia Brothers Production
text-en: Produced and Directed by HOMI WADIA

description-en: The movie "Aladdin and the Wonderful Lamp" (directed by Homi Wadia) got released in 1952. Aladdin (Mahipal) is depicted during a sword duel with the wicked courtier close to a palace like surrounding, with the djinni above holding Aladdins' palace in his hands. (gs)
description-en: Photo of a theatre stage with backdrop.

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The movie "Aladdin and his Wonderful Lamp" was directed by Homi Wadia and released in 1952. Aladdin is the story of a good-hearted, if feckless, young man who comes into untold, unearned wealth and magical powers through command of a supernatural being: a djinni/genie arrives to do his will whenever he rubs a dirty old lamp he inadvertently acquired in an enchanted cave through a wicked magician’s trickery. (Rosie Thomas) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The success of Homi Wadia’s Aladdin kick-started a new vogue for fantasy films on the B and C circuits. By the mid-1950s these and costume films together accounted for around a third of all productions. (Rosie Thomas) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Displays of fighting and pumped-up male bodies were as important to fantasy films as the special effects that created their fantastical worlds, as these composite image from Aladdin indicates. In this picture Aladdin has challenged a villainous courtier to a sword-fight to save the princess he loves from the clutches of her father’s wicked usurper. Further duels to win her hand—and save her life—take place within the enchanted palace that we see—in miniature in the top of the frame—balanced on the edge of a waterfall by the giant djinni. (Rosie Thomas) (gs)
